description: when i plug in my guitar and open guitarix i get electrical shock by the strings of my guitar,this app not safe to use
It's unbelievable the amount of options and sound quality you get with Guitarix.
summary: Still the best amp sim for Linux

description:
I can't get any sound out of it. I've tried plugging my guitar into a USB adapter, and the audio in of the sound card. Nothing. Guitarix provides no useful feedback, so I can't even tell where the problem lies

Kubuntu 19.10

(Ubuntu 18.04.3 LTS) Huge rant incoming:
Guitarix seems nice at a glance, but the thigns you have to do to get it to work, IS NOT USER FRIENDLY. AT ALL.
JACK (in qjackctl, which guitarix uses by default) is pretty finnickey, I spent hours trying to make it work. I was able to get it to play nice after lots of fiddling with soundcard switching and searching online for guides.. but after a long struggle with qjackctl crashing constantly, I switched to cadence which helped significantly (no fussing with patching/connecting NAMELESS DEVICES into each other)(no seriously, qjackctl has you fiddle with things like input_1, input_2, output_1 to 4, I HAVE NO IDEA WHICH SOUND OUTPUT/INPUT IS WHICH..) but then i had problems starting and stopping JACK services. Once i had spent hours trying to get everything to work properly and with little to no delay from my instrument to the speaker, I was left with the daunting task of setting up a cabinet from scratch in guitarix.

And at that point it wasn't worth it any more.

I installed Tonelib GFX instead of all of this headache stuff and had that program up and running after 3 minutes of instrument delay tweaking. 

In conclusion, to the developers: if you can, try to move away from JACK, or at the very least qjackctl, Jack's only powerful when it actually works.. and for god sakes, put some pre-built cabinet rigs in by default please, there's loads of pedals and stuff available and that's great, but it means nothing to me if i have no examples on how to use them properly or what they sound like..
summary: Would have been good if it didn't rely so heavily on other software

description: This has become a reliable piece of software, with sound modulation that feels like using an amplifier, with the low latency of an amplifier.

Finally decided to remove it. Can't get it to work. Only errors and tons of googling without an clear solution. Not made for human. Seems like still in 2020 things are not plug and play in linux world.
summary: Been fighting with this for an hour

description: good sounds, easy to use, and good support for midi devices
Nice amp and effects. The amp have a great presets, easy to starting while you learn how to use it in deep.
Still can't get the tuner to work, really great software otherwise.
A great software, the only guitar amp simulator i found for linux and i'm happy !

Produces great sound, installation is straightforward
Since fedora 35, pipewire is included, so no fiddling required and I can get straight to playing once I have routed the sound correctly in qjackctl's graph.
summary: Great app, has been my main amp for 4 years

description:
Für viel Gitarristen dürfte es ungewohnt sein, den Verstärker im Laptop zu haben. Doch wem es eher auf Klang als auf Haptik ankommt, wird nichts vermissen. 
Das Programm ist klanglich mMn. mit keinem anderen Verstärker vergleichbar. Man hat dann eben seinen eigenen Sound.
there is already a new version and the update does not appear here
Si vous n'avez pas d'ampli et de pédales d'effets il fait très bien l'affaire. Puissant et simple à utiliser.
При должной сноровке начинает звучать не хуже матерых vst плагинов. Достойных аналогов под linux пока больше не нашел
